bioghist.p: Leopold Stokowski (born Antoni Stanisław Bolesławowicz) (1882-1977) was the conductor of the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra, the Philadelphia Orchestra, the NBC Symphony Orchestra, Hollywood Bowl Orchestra and the Symphony of the Air. He was the founder of the New York City Symphony and The American Symphony Orchestra. He conducted the music for and appeared in Disney’s Fantasia.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of numerous recordings of performances conducted by Stokowski, including reel-to-reel and cassette tapes and 16" and 12" vinyl albums. The recordings include published albums, reproductions of published albums, and tapes of radio broadcasts. The collection also includes a gold record and master tapes from 1931-1932 recording sessions at Bell Labs and a set of 78-rpm records of Indian music, probably from the 1930s.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
